body_html:
Treatment of ./ in file_io.py matches semantics of similar functionality in io_ops.cc

IE, this works

filename_queue = tf.train.string_input_producer(["./file"])
_, serialized_example = reader.read(filename_queue)

This finds nothing

filename_queue = tf.train.string_input_producer(["file"])
_, serialized_example = reader.read(filename_queue)
body_text:
Treatment of ./ in file_io.py matches semantics of similar functionality in io_ops.cc
IE, this works
filename_queue = tf.train.string_input_producer(["./file"])
_, serialized_example = reader.read(filename_queue)

This finds nothing
filename_queue = tf.train.string_input_producer(["file"])
_, serialized_example = reader.read(filename_queue)
body:
Treatment of `./` in `file_io.py` matches semantics of similar functionality in `io_ops.cc`

IE, this works
```
filename_queue = tf.train.string_input_producer(["./file"])
_, serialized_example = reader.read(filename_queue)
```

This finds nothing
```
filename_queue = tf.train.string_input_producer(["file"])
_, serialized_example = reader.read(filename_queue)
```
